AirFireModeling 0.1.6

  • Changelog

Correlation Map

grid_correlationMap.Rd

Plots a map of the correlation of bluesky model data with a monitoring timeseries.

When colors=NULL, a color palette is given by colorRampPalette. Note: when using `plotter = ggplot`, zoom, colors and breaks are invalidated.

grid_correlationMap(bs_grid = NULL, ws_monitor = NULL,
  monitorID = NULL, parameter = "pm25", xlim = NULL, ylim = NULL,
  tlim = NULL, breaks = c(-1, -0.7, -0.5, -0.3, -0.1, 0.1, 0.3, 0.5,
  0.7, 1), colors = rev(RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(9, "RdBu")),
  zoom = 1.5, plotter = "base")

Arguments

bs_grid

bs_grid data list
ws_monitor

monitor data list
monitorID

monitor ID for correlation to model data
parameter

Data parameter to plot.
xlim

longitude range to be plotted
ylim

latitude range to be plotted
tlim

Time range tover which to calculation the correlation interpreted as UTC.
breaks

used by image() function to partition correlation values into different colors
colors

vector of colors to use
zoom

range extension as a fraction of the coordinate range
plotter

either "base" or "ggplot".

See also

grid_map

Examples

if (FALSE) {
library(PWFSLSmoke)
library(AirFireModeling)

setModelDataDir("~/Data/Bluesky")

ws_monitor <- monitor_load(20191014, 20191016) %>%
  monitor_subset(monitorIDs = "lon_.120.591_lat_38.714_arb2.1008")
bs_grid <- bluesky_load(model = "CANSAC-1.33km", modelRun = 20191014)
grid_correlationMap(bs_grid, ws_monitor)
}
